p: Phleboviruses cause human diseases, including severe fever with thrombocytopenia syndrome (SFTS), Heartland virus disease, and sandfly fever. SFTS virus is transmitted by Haemaphysalis longicornis ticks, causing hundreds of cases in China, Japan, and Korea annually. SFTS can lead to multi-organ failure and death. Heartland virus is thought to be transmitted by the Lone Star tick, and has been identified in a handful of cases in the United States. Sandfly fever viruses are transmitted by Phlebotomus sandflies in the Mediterranean, Middle East, and South Asia. Sandfly fever is usually a self-limited febrile illness; however, Toscana virus causes central nervous system disease.
